items.content_html: That‚Äôs as good as a Super Bowl can get as long as the Seahawks aren‚Äôt winning it. Congratulations Eagles! I especially liked when we whooped you 24-10 with your golden boy quarterback. That was a fun night üòä
I missed the Solo trailer premiere, which was shown while I was changing a poopy diaper. The crap I endure sometimes‚Ä¶

Tweetstorms should not be used in place of blog posts. I just read a really great chain of thoughts that I really wish was a blog post that I could point a link to, but instead I‚Äôd have to pick one or two tweets that I hope get displayed properly in your client of choice.
Throwing this out there hypothetically of course, but if I have any Apple employee friends who don‚Äôt want to use their HomePod discount, I‚Äôd be happy to take it off their hands.

I‚Äôm starting a Rubber Ducking group of text files to try to figure out solutions to my programming problems. In a completely open office talking to a rubber duck would feel super awkward. This should be a good replacement for pinging coworkers on Slack.
Sending a fax like it‚Äôs 1998, only on the internet because it‚Äôs 2018. Why do fraud places that handle ‚Äúsensitive information‚Äù think that this is still a secure way to send data?

I learned today that iCloud syncs iPhone call histories. I‚Äôve got a work phone that‚Äôs been buzzing with pages all week, and those calls are on my personal phone‚Äôs history. Crazy. And there‚Äôs no way to disable that sync as far as I can tell.
Ugh. Dealing with identity theft that you thought you‚Äôd taken care of years ago is the worst.
I‚Äôve really been enjoying The Omni Show, and am looking forward to listening to this week‚Äôs episode with Ken Case. Thanks Omni!
